txt.en: Instance: Facing His Fear
Raphûz is too injured to continue. You have failed

'My friend, I could not have succeeded without you. I still will not stray so near to a boar that it could gore me without holding a weapon.

'But my fear of the creatures is diminished thanks to you.

'Please visit me in the Wrackwade, where I can thank you more formally.'
After defeating the beast Raphûz wants to speak to you in a safer part of the area.
Raphûz wishes to speak with you
Speak with Raphûz to continue the hunt
Speak with Raphûz to continue the hunt

'I will steel my nerve, [placeholder]. I must overcome my fear.'

He swallows hard.

'All the same, I am glad you are here with me.'
Speak to Raphûz
Raphûz wants to prove his bravery and face his fear by seeking out the \qlargest boar in Ambarûl,\q Urushagân. He asked you to accompany him.

'No, no friend. My resolve is stalwart. I only wonder which trail to follow to discover the beast.'

He looks at the paths and then chooses.

'Let us search there, friend.'
Raphûz appears nervous. Speak with his to calm his nerves and begin your search for Urushagân.
Calm Raphûz's nerves and begin the hunt
You fought alongside Raphûz to the centre of the boar den. He looks as though he could use some reassurance. Speak with him.
Assist and protect Raphûz as you search for Urushagân
Assist and protect Raphûz as you search for Urushagân
Raphûz wants to speak to you
Speak with Raphûz and continue the hunt
Raphûz is too injured to continue. You have failed
Raphûz was too badly injured. You have failed
Raphûz is pleased and begins his journey toward Wrackwade
Raphûz's confidence is building. He believes Urushagân must be further in the boar den.
Assist and protect Raphûz as you search for Urushagân
Raphûz is too injured to continue. You have failed
Raphûz is undeterred by not yet finding Urushagân. He urges you to help him press onward.
Assist and protect Raphûz as you search for Urushagân
Raphûz wishes to speak
'We will find him yet. I can see another hollow on the rise above. Let us move swiftly.'

'Is this beast another Shagâni myth?'

He smirks.

'Come, I think there is another hollow above where the beast must be.'
Raphûz looks tired, but resolved. Speak with him
